lead_paragraph: ROSENFIELD--Herbert. Born August 6, 1918 and died July 20, 2016. Son of Bertha Fischman Rosenfield and Abner Benjamin Rosenfield and grandson of William Fischman and Pauline Levy Fischman, and Solomon Rosenfield and Leah Robinson Rosenfield. His beloved wife, Audrey Priest Rosenfield, like his parents and grandparents, predeceased him. A dedicated lifelong New Yorker, he was president for more than forty years of the family textile firm, Continental Convertors Corporation. He served in the Army from 1940-1946 and saw action in France and Germany as Warrant Officer/ Assistant Adjutant to the Commanding Officer of the 212th Coast Guard Artillery Anti-Aircraft and then Adjutant to the Commanding Officer of the 541st Field Artillery European Theater. Herb served regularly on the Grand Jury of the County of New York. As founder and then president of the Chambers - Canal Civic Association, he and his colleagues supported small businesses and fought for better residential conditions, such as the law allowing artists to work and live in lofts. Appointed to Community Board #
